main event: A civilian reported seeing a strange reddish-orange light in the sky near Rossburg, Ohio on March 3, 1964.
interesting points: The object was about 50 yards wide and traveling at an altitude of around 500 feet.
The light would disappear and reappear at irregular intervals, with a bright white light in the center.
The sighting lasted for approximately 10-15 minutes before the object disappeared.
The observer stated the object was similar to the satellite decay reported on March 3, 1968.
The Air Force requested the observer complete an AF Form 117 for further investigation.
sighted object: A reddish-orange light with a bright white center
